  • "core/Engine"
  • Engine

Class Engine

// Anytime before calling the start method...
const renderer = new EIGHT.Engine()

// When the canvas is available, usually in the window.onload function...
renderer.start(canvas)

// At the start of each animation frame, before drawing...
renderer.clear()

// When no longer needed, usually in the window.onunload function...
renderer.release()

mayUseCache

  • get mayUseCache(): boolean
  • set mayUseCache(mayUseCache: boolean): void
    • Defined in core/Engine.ts:185

    Determines whether this Engine may use a cache to optimize WebGLREnderingContext calls.

    The default value of this property is true. Set this property to false if the WebGL API is being called directly (not through Engine).

    default

    true

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in core/Engine.ts:188

    Determines whether this Engine may use a cache to optimize WebGLREnderingContext calls.

    The default value of this property is true. Set this property to false if the WebGL API is being called directly (not through Engine).

    Parameters

    • mayUseCache: boolean

    Returns void

Protected setLoggingName

  • setLoggingName(name: string): void

  • Inherited from default.setLoggingName

    • Defined in core/ShareableBase.ts:188

    This method is for use within constructors.

    Immediately after a call to the super class constructor, make a call to setLoggingName. This will have the effect of refining the name used for reporting reference counts.

    This method has the secondary purpose of enabling a tally of the number of classes in the constructor chain. This enables the runtime architecture to verify that destructor chains are consistent with constructor chains, which is a good practice for cleaning up resources.

    Notice that this method is intentionally protected to discourage it from being called outside of the constructor.

    method

    setLoggingName

    Parameters

    • name: string

    Returns void

Object literals

Private _viewportArgs

_viewportArgs: object
  • Defined in core/Engine.ts:74

A cache of the parameters used in the last gl.viewport method call. width and height must be positive so this cache is initially dirty.
